alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Early (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 7:28AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Dale, Henry, eastern Geneva and Houston Counties in southeastern Alabama, southern Clay, northwestern Calhoun and northwestern Early Counties in southwestern Georgia through 815 AM EST/715 AM CST/... At 728 AM EST/628 AM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Fort Gaines to 6 miles south of Hartford. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Cottonwood, Fort Gaines, Headland, Dothan, Blakely, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Kinsey, Ashford, Slocomb, Cowarts, Edison, Webb, Columbia, Pinckard, Malvern, Rehobeth and Grimes. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST/1100 AM CST/ for southeastern Alabama...and southwestern Georgia.
